name: Park Lane Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: unbeatable location with a dining room that faces central park.
reviews.title: classic new york hotel needs updating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: particularly busy during the holiday season as its really close to the ice skating rink, expensive boutiques and rockefeller center so very festive but crowded
reviews.title: They should be thankful they're locating where they are.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: passable breakfast but served with style. very friendly and helpful staff but cleaning service inefficient. rooms are a good size, comfortable bed, towels, bathrooms small but all of them need to be refurnished. noisy airconditioning but atleast it works!
reviews.title: If You Can Get a Deal, Stay Here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the business package gets you 2 free cocktails per night at harrys bar (a low key nie bar but stick with wine because they all come from preprepared mixes which leave alot to be desired) free long distance calls and a bagel and coffee for breakfast.
reviews.title: A Good Location for a short holiday in New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you like rude front of house staff who have no idea how to answer anything from a parking question to a "good place to eat" question (which I'M CERTAIN they should know) and getting a "deluxe city view" which actually look onto a parking lot, then this is the place for you! The location is the only thing that saves it and everyone there sort of lets you know that.
reviews.title: We loved the Park Lane

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the hotel offers great rooms with a view of central park from high up.
reviews.title: reliable and nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the rooms are clean and elegant on the higher floors. the lower levels are pretty standard fare.
reviews.title: Decent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: the terrace restaurant is a great place for breakfast. the hotel is centrally located and a fun place to stay in the city.
reviews.title: A bad remake of 1970s NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed for three nights in December for a supise birthday treat.
reviews.title: My got-to New York Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Room available early for check in which was a huge bonus after a flight from UK. Large room with a good view of the city and the park ( although descibed as a city view room). Great location on central park south. Rooms a bit tired looking altough clean and pleasant.
reviews.title: for me the best hotel i have stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The 2 Bedroom suite (2 bedrooms plus loungeroom) on the 40th floor provided our family of five with a wonderful location for our Christmas stay. The view of central park truly was amazing. Booking through the hotel direct is the best way to get a great deal. Unexpectedly breakfast was included which was a simple breakfast of fruit, yoghurt, pastries, juice and tea/coffee but the view of central park from the restaurant was beautiful. We will definitely return to the Helmsley for it's wonderful location and lovely suite.
reviews.title: 40TH FLOOR SUITE WITH AMAZING CP VIEWS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has an excellent location on central park. The hotel was decorated for the holidays and was very elegant. The upgraded room my husband received was spacious and comfortable with a king bed (he had arrived on initially on business and I arrived later to take advantage of New York during the holidays. The only issue we had with the room was the heat level. Despite turning down the thermostat, the heat remained in the 70's. Staff made an effort to fix once, but it only lasted one evening. The restaurant has a beautiful view of central park. The food is good, the staff friendly, however if it is very busy, they have a difficult time keeping up.
reviews.title: Old world class - great holiday stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband booked us into a Park View room at the Helmsley Park Lane (and paid in advance) for an important Birthday. He contacted them in advance to say when we would arrive so our room would be reserved and he requested a bottle of wine on our arrival. When we arrived we were given a subpar room (a large area broken and with rusted surface around the bathtub drain, no park view), that the manager insisted had just been renovated. We complained and after a considerable amount of arguing were finally put in a large room with a park view the next day, but also after being told two different stories, the first being that they would move our things to the new room while we were out, and the other that we had to be there while they moved our things, meaning we would be stuck in the hotel at 3pm (the middle of our day in NY!)
reviews.title: Good but Be Wary!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That morning we had a terrible experience at the continental breakfast. The manager, who did apologize later, seated us after a long wait (getting us dangerously close to cut off time) and then it took four additional requests (I had to get up and find someone as no one would approach us) for me to get a pot of black tea, which was the very first thing I requested to our server when we were seated. To be fair, once we argued and complained (an unpleasant thing to have to do on your birthday!) we were moved to a beautiful room with a magnificent view, and treated to cake and champagne, although they tried to charge us for these "gifts of apology" when we checked out as "room service". The place has some beautiful rooms, with wonderful views but frankly, the management seems to be a mess. If you book, talk to the manager first, check in early to get the room you pay for, go to the continental breakfast early to get any food or drink, and check your bill carefully. If all of these things go smoothly, you might have a stay to remember.
reviews.title: Grande Dame with lots of Character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel for the obvious, a view of Central Park. Travelling off-season, I found a great rate for a Junior Suite Park view. When I checked in, the hotel staff looked for the highest available floor without my request...off to a good start! The bellmen and staff make you feel like a regular with their genuine warmth and eagerness to please. The way things work here is you can ask for nearly anything and the staff will go out of their way to accomodate you. Also many extras are included in standard pricing so you won't get nickel and dimed for extras. The only reason I didn't give it a fifth star is because it is just a bit older, so you have to turn on the lights individually, etc., and the hotels I rated 5 stars were technologically impressive. But I loved my stay here.
reviews.title: new york break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here several times, have a fantastic location in front of the central park, helpfull staff and close to the 5 ave. great restaurant options close to it. The rooms need some renewing.
reviews.title: Out of date, but romantic and well placed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed there over 20 times as it is the company hotel. REally love it.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, great staff, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 7 nights to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. The location was excellent, being close to several metro lines, and being right on central park. Our room was to the rear of the hotel, but was fairly quiet being high up. The hotel was very clean, but it is quite dated in terms of décor with fussy mock-French furniture and brass mirrored ceilings. The room was very spacious which surprised me as I'd been expecting a New York broom cupboard. The bedding was all clean and white though which was nice. Our cleaners did a great job, and picked up on the fact I had a cold and left me some spare boxes of tissues which I found thoughtful. The concierge was a bit hard to get hold of, and the front desk staff a bit rushed. Overall we didn't have any problems with the hotel, and would consider it again, but it could really do with some less 1980s décor.
reviews.title: Lovely doorman, fantastic location, dated decor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: On our trips to New York City for client meetings we have always stayed at this hotel. The location is perfect for us and we love the view of Central Park. This year because of tis past weekend being so close to Christmas it was indeed very busy. As we had breakfast included in our rate (roomservice or the dinning room) we ordered room service. We were told it would be "up right away" an hour later the coffee arrived but no breakfast. Then a half hour later the breakfast came. However there were no knives so we buttered our toast with our spoons. The next morning we decided we would go to the dinning room. The wait to be seated was onerous with vacated tables in sight. It took almost
reviews.title: Great hotel but disappointing service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you are looking service, it would be better to choose another hotel. Fantastic location, the view (if you book park view room), nothing more.
reviews.title: Just Location and View

description: Elegant, midtown tower hotel overlooking Central Park - Convenient to Fifth Avenue shopping and Broadway theaters.
